item.title: Sean add a quote by Henry Ford
item.description: "Whether you think you can, or you think you can't--you're right." -- Henry Ford

item.title: Sean add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description:
"We are not afraid to entrust the American people with unpleasant facts, foreign ideas, alien philosophies, and competitive values. For a nation that is afraid to let its people judge the truth and falsehood in an open market is a nation that is afraid of its people."
[<i>Remarks on the 20th Anniversary of the Voice of America</i>; Department of Health, Education, and Welfare, February 26, 1962]" -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Sean add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sean add a quote by Winston Churchhill
item.description: "We make a living by what we get. We make a life by what we give." -- Winston Churchhill

item.title: Sean add a quote by Joseph Addison
item.description: "Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body." -- Joseph Addison

item.title: Sean add a quote by Bob Marley
item.description: "None but ourselves can free our minds." -- Bob Marley

item.title: Sean add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Any fool can make a rule And any fool will mind it." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Sean add a quote by Norman Vincent Peale
item.description: "The way to happiness: Keep your heart free from hate, your mind from worry. Live simply, expect little, give much. Scatter sunshine, forget self, think of others. Try this for a week and you will be surprised." -- Norman Vincent Peale

item.title: Sean add a quote by Robert Anton Wilson
item.description: "...an optimistic mind-set finds dozens of possible solutions for every problem that the pessimist regards as incurable." -- Robert Anton Wilson

item.title: Sean add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I think each village was meant to feel pity for its own sick and poor whom it can help and I doubt if it is the duty of any private person to fix his mind on ills which he cannot help. This may even become an escape from the works of charity we really can do to those we know. God may call any one of us to respond to some far away problem or support those who have been so called. But we are finite and he will not call us everywhere or to support every worthy cause. And real needs are not far from us." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Sean add a quote by Sakyong Mipham Rinpoche
item.description: " Many of us are slaves to our minds. Our own mind is our worst enemy. We try to focus, and our mind wanders off. We try to keep stress at bay, but anxiety keeps us awake at night. We try to be good to the people we love, but then we forget them and put ourselves first. And when we want to change our life, we dive into spiritual practice and expect quick results, only to lose focus after the honeymoon has worn off. We return to our state of bewilderment. We're left feeling helpless and discouraged. It seems we all agree that training the body through exercise, diet, and relaxation is a good idea, but why don't we think about training our minds?" -- Sakyong Mipham Rinpoche

item.title: Sean add a quote by Otto Frank
item.description: "There are no walls, no bolts, no locks that anyone ca nput on your mind." -- Otto Frank

item.title: Sean add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Rejoice in the Lord always. I will say it again Rejoice! Let your gentleness be evident to all. The Lord is near. Do not be anxious about anything, but in everything, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving, present your requests to God. And the peace of God, which transcends all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus." -- Anonymous

item.title: Sean add a quote by Louise L. Hay
item.description:
"You have the power to heal your life, and you need to know that. We think so often that we are helpless, but we're not. We always have the power of our mindsâ€¦Claim and consciously use your power.
" -- Louise L. Hay

item.title: Sean add a quote by Herbert A. Simon
item.description: "Enlightenments, like accidents, happen only to prepared minds. " -- Herbert A. Simon

item.title: Sean add a quote by Sophia Loren
item.description: "There is a fountain of youth: it is your mind, your talents, the creativity you bring to your life and the lives of people you love. When you learn to tap this source, you will truly have defeated age." -- Sophia Loren

item.title: Sean add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "To a mind that is still the whole universe surrenders." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Sean add a quote by Samuel Johnson
item.description: "My dear friend, clear your mind of cant [excessive thought]. You may <i>talk</i> as other people do: you may say to a man, "Sir, I am your most humble servant." You are not his most humble servant. You may say, "These are bad times; it is a melancholy thing to be reserved to such times." You don't mind the times ... You may <i>talk</i> in this manner; it is a mode of talking in Society; but don't <i>think</i> foolishly." -- Samuel Johnson

item.title: Sean add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "A human being is a part of the whole called by us universe, a part limited in time and space. He experiences himself, his thoughts and feeling as something separated from the rest, a kind of optical delusion of his consciousness. This delusion is a kind of prison for us, restricting us to our personal desires and to affection for a few persons nearest to us. Our task must be to free ourselves from this prison by widening our circle of compassion to embrace all living creatures and the whole of nature in its beauty." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sean add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "And, when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Sean add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Good books don't give up all their secrets at once." -- Stephen King
